p: To perform an adequate risk/benefit assessment of the current medication standard, it is necessary to compare the daily amount of excipients in the most vulnerable patient with clinically established safety levels for the same age group. The SEEN project is an example of this, as it developed a retrospective cohort study, with neonatal patients (age 5 or younger) treated with multiple medicines. Preparations were recorded with ethanol, propylene glycol, benzyl alcohol, parabens, aspartame, glycerol, sorbitol and polysorbate-80 and cumulative amounts [ 24] were calculated.
